Sentencas: Reversible solid oxide cell (rSOC) can flexibly switch between fuel cell and electrolyzer, making it promising for power generation and storage.
Titulo: Thermal management of reversible solid oxide cells in the dynamic mode switching

Sentencas: However, the dynamic mode switching causes reversed electrochemical reactions and severe temperature fluctuation, leading to performance decline and even cell failure.
Titulo: Thermal management of reversible solid oxide cells in the dynamic mode switching

Sentencas: Herein, we propose a thermal management strategy that combines rSOC with thermochemical energy storage (TES) to store/supply heat during exothermic/endothermic processes.
Titulo: Thermal management of reversible solid oxide cells in the dynamic mode switching

Sentencas: Performance of the integrated new system is evaluated by a 2D non-adiabatic dynamic model.
Titulo: Thermal management of reversible solid oxide cells in the dynamic mode switching

Sentencas: It is found that the maximum temperature difference across the cell surface can be reduced by 75.7 % at 0.75 V, where 18.21 % of the fuel enthalpy is stored in the TES section.
Titulo: Thermal management of reversible solid oxide cells in the dynamic mode switching

Sentencas: Besides, a small air flow rate of 10 SCCM is enough to maintain a hot standby state during the shutdown stage, which reduces the energy consumption by 99.5 % compared with the hot air purging method.
Titulo: Thermal management of reversible solid oxide cells in the dynamic mode switching

Sentencas: The temperature change rate in the switching process between the fuel cell mode and the shutdown stage is also decreased by 69 % on average.
Titulo: Thermal management of reversible solid oxide cells in the dynamic mode switching

Sentencas: This work identifies the key characteristics of rSOC during mode switching and provides a new method towards its safe and economic operation when combining with fluctuating renewable powers.
Titulo: Thermal management of reversible solid oxide cells in the dynamic mode switching
